Discover the basics of this package and explore all the possibilities Odoo offers to improve your experience.

template.p: You can access every installed App in your Odoo database on your main dashboard.

ul.li: Use the Manufacturing App to efficiently plan and execute production orders to meet customer demand.
Process manufacturing work orders with instructions from the Shopfloor App .
Manage the purchase of raw materials from the Purchase App.
From the Inventory App, keep track of produced lots and expiration dates.
Generate crystal clear quotations with the Sales App.
Invoice your customers from the Invoicing App.

template.p: By uploading this module's demo data, your database has been filled with a few products, sale orders and more.
You should be able to execute the following flows to have an overview of various flows you can quickly execute with this package using Odoo.
Of course, this is just an overview of the features included in this package. Feel free to add new apps, delete/modify demo data, and test everything around!

template.p: From the Sales App, you can manage your orders.

ul.li: You are ready to sign your first customers? To do so, open the Sales App, create a new order and the customer.
Fill in the form by creating or selecting a customer contact.
Select a quotation template to save time for an installation.

div.class: o_editor_banner user-select-none o-contenteditable-false lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3
o_editor_banner_content o-contenteditable-true w-100 px-3
div.p: Save time preparing the quotation templates which correspond to your frequent segments!

ul.li: Send your quotation for online signature.
Confirm the order to close your deal.

template.p: You can now hurry to manufacture the needed products, deliver them prior sending the invoice to bill your customer.
Whether you want to plan your production based on existing sales orders, or based on a forecast, you can use the master production schedule from the Manufacturing App .

ul.li:
Open the Master Production Schedule from the Planning menu.
Don't panic, this will become your best buddy to optimize your production!
First, you might want to fill in your estimated Forecasted Demand for your finished products, in this case, Mayonnaise Bucket and Dispenser.

div.class: o_editor_banner user-select-none o-contenteditable-false lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3
o_editor_banner_content o-contenteditable-true w-100 px-3
div.p: A good practice might be to keep those forecasts up to date for the coming months with your sales, so that the manufacturing team plans at best the production at all time accordingly!

ul.li: Depending on your current stock level, an appropriate replenishment suggestion will be created for the final product and its components via the indirect demand, for instance here: the Bucket and the Dispenser, as well as the Mayonnaise down below.

When hovering the on the Order button for a product Replenishment, a cell is highlighted. Clicking this button orders the corresponding product for that period according to the Replenishment input.
This creates a manufacturing order or a purchase order depending on the product configuration.

There is some stock of Buckets and Dispensers so no need to order some for the ongoing period.
However, you need to order Mayonnaise Buckets to meet your forecast!
Doing so, you have generated a new manufacturing order which is now visible for your operators.
Also order the Mayonnaise so you can fill those buckets with sauce.

div.class: o_editor_banner user-select-none o-contenteditable-false lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-success pb-0 pt-3
o_editor_banner_content o-contenteditable-true w-100 px-3
div.p: You can see that the replenishment for the Mayonnaise comes as multiple of the batch size. You can adjust this editing the Mayonnaise Production Schedule from the pen icon near its name.
This is great but you might be producing more Mayonnaise than you planned to package...

No worries, simply increase the Replenishment for a product packaging Mayonnaise to grow the indirect demand of Mayonnaise just below your Actual Replenishment.
This way, you make sure to package all you can, to deliver your customers according to your forecast, and have some buffer to start from next month.

template.p: Now let's see how spread the work load from the resulting manufacturing orders.

ul.li: Open the list of manufacturing orders from the Operations menu.
Open the Mayonnaise Bucket for example since packaging such a quantity may not happen in one day.

Near its name, click the gear icon and select the split option.
Define the Max Batch Size to correspond typically to the packaging of a Mayonnaise tank, 35 buckets in for example.

Define dates to plan those smaller orders along the corresponding period to smoothen the load and then proceed to the split.
As a result, the initial order has been split into multiple smaller orders.
Now come back to the list of manufacturing orders and open the calendar view from the top right hand side.

div.class: o_editor_banner user-select-none o-contenteditable-false lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3
o_editor_banner_content o-contenteditable-true w-100 px-3
div.p: The Gantt view is available as well for even more intelligible planning from version 19.

ul.li:
Drag and drop manufacturing orders to spread evenly the load between Mayonnaise manufacturing and packaging into buckets and dispensers.
You're all set for production!

template.p: Some plan, others produce... Open the Shop Floor App to manufacture products.

ul.li: All Manufacturing Orders here are Ready to manufacture by default but you can play with the filters at top right of the screen to see them all.
Click on one of the Ready orders to produce some Mayonnaise.
Follow the step from each operation to prepare your Mayonnaise batch.
Click the Close Production button at the end of the tile when done with all steps. Great you manufactured you first Mayonnaise batch!

div.class: o_editor_banner user-select-none o-contenteditable-false lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-success pb-0 pt-3
o_editor_banner_content o-contenteditable-true w-100 px-3
div.p: You registered your first lot of Mayonnaise. Note that it is possible to change the lot number prefix from the product form, in the Inventory tab.

ul.li: Let's now package the Mayonnaise now: Click on a Mayonnaise Bucket order to start the packaging.
Follow as well the steps and close the production. Great, you now have some products to ship to delight customers.

div.class: o_editor_banner user-select-none o-contenteditable-false lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3
o_editor_banner_content o-contenteditable-true w-100 px-3
div.p: You can setup your Bill of Material to reflect on you production processes with or without steps, with embedded quality checks like in this example or after a production.
The Bill of Material is accessible from the Manufacturing App Products menu.

div.class: o_editor_banner user-select-none o-contenteditable-false lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3
o_editor_banner_content o-contenteditable-true w-100 px-3
div.p: The Mixing tank work center is configured with setup and cleanup time. Take advantage of this capability to optimize your operations!

template.p: Producing efficiently is key for your business and doing so without running out of supplies is paramount. Let's open the Inventory App to see how to handle this aspect.

ul.li: Open the Replenishment from Operations menu.
Some rules are defined to easily resupply ingredients and containers.
You can see you're about to get low on Vinegar and Mustard in the Forecast.

div.class: o_editor_banner user-select-none o-contenteditable-false lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3
o_editor_banner_content o-contenteditable-true w-100 px-3
div.p: You can see the forecast clicking the chart icon. Down below, you can see that this is the outcome of all the planned Manufacturing Orders...
As an Inventory Manager you need to make sure that the production team never runs out of supply!

ul.li: On the Vinager Replenishment rule, hit the Order button. This creates a Purchase Order for this product according to the min and max input, which you can edit. Hit the Order button for Mustard while you're here to add those items to the recent Purchase Order.

Having to follow up on supplies stock might be a repetitive task and you might forget... To help you with that, you can automate those orders. Filter on Auto Trigger in the left hand side tab to see already automated Replenishment Rules. Those rules will be triggered automatically to ensure you never run out of containers, that would be a shame to through away tasty Mayonnaise by lack of Buckets...
While you are using Inventory App, open the product catalog from the Products menu. This gives you a more comprehensive view of the different products you manipulate.
Open one of the finished product and navigate to the Inventory tab.
Here you can find some logistical data to optimize your deliveries.
The Dates section allows you to detail the expiration dates of your products.

div.class: o_editor_banner user-select-none o-contenteditable-false lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-success pb-0 pt-3
o_editor_banner_content o-contenteditable-true w-100 px-3
div.p: Between production and deliveries, by default, the product picking is organized in FIFO.

ul.li: Open the Purchase App and the recently created Purchase Order.

The products from the Replenishment Rules you triggered are here but not all products have Replenishment Rules at this stage. For some products or other suppliers you need, you can chose to add them manually to a Purchase Order and even create new Purchase Orders.
Add some Salt and Sugar to secure suppliers for longer on those sides.
Now Send the Request For Quotation to your supplier if willing to iterate on price for example.
Confirm the Purchase Order when in agreement with your supplier.
There now is a smart button at the top of the Purchase Order to reach the associated delivery. Hit the Deliveries smart button to open the delivery.

When the truck arrives and you add those to your stock, validate the delivery to update your stock levels. Don't forget to set the Lot reference in the details of the delivery lines. You're now ready to product Mayonnaise for some time!

div.class: o_editor_banner user-select-none o-contenteditable-false lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3
o_editor_banner_content o-contenteditable-true w-100 px-3
div.p: To save time and prevent mistake of typo in the Lot inputs, you might want to work with Barcode App!

template.p: One last step prior billing with the Invoicing App, delivering!

ul.li: From the Sale Order you confirmed, you can find a smart button to the associated delivery at the top.
Validate the delivery to your customer to complete the job.
Now come back to the Sale Order which you can bill since delivered.
Create an Invoice, send it to your customer and confirm it to get paid for your hard work!
